items.title: These are the most active investors in Hong Kong’s startups
Indian geotech acquires 9.37% stake in AI startup SimDaas
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- MapmyIndia acquires 9.37% stake in AI startup SimDaas Autonomy for approximately 3 crore rupees (US$347,067).
- Deal finalized on January 24, includes equity infusion and issuance of 13,671 compulsorily convertible preference shares, totaling 2.99 crore rupees (US$345,910).
- SimDaas Autonomy focuses on simulation technologies for autonomous systems and advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS), founded in 2023 by Sunit Arya.
- As of January 27, shares of MapmyIndia trade at 1,661 rupees (US$19.22) on the Bombay Stock Exchange.

items.title: Chinese robot maker Ubtech to mass produce humanoids by 2025
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- Ubtech plans to mass produce humanoid robots by 2025.
- The company aims to enhance robotics capabilities and expand its market. 
- Ubtech is known for its innovative technologies in the robotics space.

items.title: Indian news giants sue OpenAI over copyright violations
items.summary:
- Indian digital news organizations, supported by Gautam Adani and Mukesh Ambani, have sued OpenAI for copyright infringement.
- NDTV, Network18, the Indian Express, and Hindustan Times allege that ChatGPT scraped their content without permission.
- The Digital News Publishers Association (DNPA) backs the lawsuit, emphasizing threats to Indian publishers' copyrights.
- The Times of India is a DNPA member but has not participated in this lawsuit.
- OpenAI has collaboration agreements with international media but lacks similar arrangements with Indian publishers, affecting their businesses negatively.

items.title: Coins.ph turnaround to profit isn’t just about Trump, CEO says
items.author: Wei Zhou
items.summary:
- Coins.ph CEO Wei Zhou attributes the company's profitability in 2024 to the crypto boom following Donald Trump's return to the White House.
- Trump signed an executive order prioritizing the crypto industry after his election in November, leading to a bitcoin price increase from US$40,000 to over US$100,000.
- Coins.ph faced significant losses in 2022 and 2023, with total losses of US$16.6 million and US$18.7 million respectively, alongside a US$6 million hack.
- Despite financial difficulties, Zhou reported that Coins.ph's trading volume increased over 3x to US$1 billion a month in 2024, with revenue growing more than 4x compared to 2023.

items.title: Hope springs eternal for Asia’s IPO market
items.summary:
- Asia's IPO market shows signs of recovery amid global economic challenges.
- Notable IPOs include companies in tech, healthcare, and consumer sectors.
- Increased investor interest and government support may drive future listings.

items.title: The 50 top-funded AI startups in Asia
items.summary:
- The article lists the top 50 AI companies in Asia based on funding raised from investors.
- It utilizes data from Tech in Asia, with a focus on funding data from the past two years.
- The funding data is updated daily to reflect the latest information.

items.title: DeepSeek surpasses ChatGPT on Apple App Store in US
items.summary:
- DeepSeek has outperformed ChatGPT in downloads on the US Apple App Store.
- The app's success highlights growing competition in the AI chatbot market.
- This milestone reflects user preferences shifting towards alternatives to established AI platforms.

items.title: Indian fintech Slice Bank seeks $300m in funding
items.summary:
- Slice Bank, based in Bengaluru, is seeking to raise between $250 million and $300 million.
- The funding follows its merger with North East Small Finance Bank approved by the Reserve Bank of India in October.
- The bank is rolling out services to selected users and plans to offer merchant lending and payment services.
- Slice Bank operates 200 branches and aims to grow its customer base from 11 million to over 70 million by 2030.
- The bank is valued between $1.3 billion and $1.5 billion, with an annual revenue run rate of 1,200 crore rupees ($138.94 million).

items.title: TikTok Shop doubles GMV to $33.2b, US leads growth
items.summary:
- TikTok Shop's global GMV in 2024 reached $33.2 billion, more than doubling from the previous year.
- The US is the largest market with $9 billion in GMV, despite launching only in September 2023.
- TikTok Shop hosts 398,000 stores and 10.9 million influencers in the US.
- 58% of GMV came from videos, with shops contributing 32% and livestreaming 10%.
- Key product categories in the US include beauty and personal care, womenswear, and outdoor sports.
- Health and automotive sectors saw over tenfold GMV growth year-on-year.
- Live selling is emerging in the US with only four sessions exceeding $1 million in GMV.

items.title: SK hynix appoints VP Ryu Sung-soo as CEO of US unit
items.summary:
- SK hynix has appointed Ryu Sung-soo as the CEO of its US unit.
- Ryu is expected to enhance the company's strategic operations in the US market.
- This appointment comes as part of SK hynix's efforts to strengthen its global presence.

items.title: Apple’s next move in Indonesia: partner, invest, or leave?
items.summary:
- Apple is facing challenges in Indonesia due to local content requirements, leading to a ban on the sale of the iPhone 16.
- Apple proposed investing $1 billion in a factory for AirTag production, but the Indonesian government found it insufficient.
- The Indonesian government aims to localize production to enhance workforce skills and capture greater economic benefits from foreign companies.
- Countries like Vietnam and India are competing for Apple’s investments, prompting Indonesia to secure similar investments to remain competitive.

items.title: Chip designer’s potential fee hike puts pressure on Samsung
items.summary:
- Samsung Electronics may see increased costs in Exynos processor development due to potential royalty increases of up to 300% by Arm.
- Arm controls over 90% of the application processor market and is pushing for royalty hikes following an unsuccessful court attempt against Qualcomm.
- Samsung utilizes Arm’s technology for its Exynos chips and is under pressure to adapt amid these potential changes.
- The company is working on the Exynos 2600 for future smartphones but will require long-term strategies for improvement.
- Recent developments include delays in product launches and strategies to combat US tariffs on chip production.

items.title: SG’s Elev8.vc closes $30m fund to support deeptech startups
items.summary:
- Elev8.vc has successfully closed a $30 million fund.
- The fund aims to support deeptech startups in Singapore.
- This initiative reflects increasing investment interest in the deeptech sector.

items.title: DeepSeek unveils cost-efficient AI model to rival OpenAI
items.summary:
- DeepSeek has launched a new AI model aimed at providing a cost-effective alternative to OpenAI's offerings.
- The model is designed to be more accessible for businesses and developers, reducing operational costs associated with AI deployment.
- DeepSeek aims to capture a significant share of the AI market by catering to smaller enterprises that need affordable solutions.

items.title: Nissan reconsiders US EV production amid tax concerns
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Nissan is reevaluating plans to boost EV production in the US due to possible changes in tax incentives under the Trump administration.
- The retention of the US$7,500 federal tax credit is critical for the Canton, Mississippi facility's ability to produce EVs.
- Proposed changes may delay the launch of four new EV models from 2028 to potentially 2027.
- Nissan might cut production volumes for EVs at its Smyrna, Tennessee facility in favor of hybrid models.
- The company will cease production of the Infiniti QX50 and QX55 in Aguascalientes, Mexico, by December 2025 due to low demand, while other operations will continue unaffected.
- These developments occur amidst uncertainties about trade policies, including potential tariffs on exports to the US.

items.title: Perplexity’s new TikTok bid could give US gov’t 50% stake
items.summary:
- Perplexity AI has proposed that the US government could own up to 50% of a new entity by merging Perplexity with TikTok's US operations.
- The government would receive non-voting shares and have no representatives on the board.
- ByteDance must transfer proprietary algorithms that affect the app's user experience.
- This proposal is a revision of an earlier bid made on January 18, prior to a law banning TikTok.

items.title: Israeli fintech BitStock raises $400k seed funding
items.summary:
- BitStock has raised an additional US$400,000 in seed funding, total investment now at US$1 million.
- Funding will be allocated for marketing, sales, R&D, and operations.
- Company was founded in 2024 and specializes in cryptocurrency investment via its Ten Best Coins (TBC) index.
- TBC tracks the top 10 cryptocurrencies by market capitalization, managed by a supportive algorithm.
- TBC has been publicly traded on crypto exchanges since late 2022.

items.title: Samsung delays smart glasses launch, focuses on partnership
items.author: Hyesoon Jeong
items.summary:
- Samsung's anticipated smart glasses will not debut in 2025.
- Hyesoon Jeong confirmed the delay during a showcase at the Unpacked event in San Jose, California.
- The glasses are part of a collaboration with Google on the Android XR operating system and will launch when ready.

items.title: Musk explores blockchain for US government efficiency
items.summary:
* Elon Musk leads the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), focusing on blockchain for federal operations.
* Initiative aims to modernize technology and reduce government spending, initiated by an executive order from President Trump.
* DOGE is assessing public blockchain platforms for tracking spending, securing data, and managing payments.
* Experts, including Duke University's Campbell Harvey, express concerns over governance challenges with decentralized public blockchains.
* Previous enterprise blockchain projects reported efficiency and cost-effectiveness issues.
* Uncertainty exists over which blockchain DOGE may select, with discussions possibly not yielding actionable outcomes.

items.title: Shein confirms no Chinese cotton in US products sold
items.author: Yinan Zhu
items.summary:
- Shein requires manufacturers to source cotton from approved regions for US products, excluding China.
- Approved sources include Australia, Brazil, India, the US, and limited cases from Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and Southeast Asia.
- This policy follows the Uyghur Forced Labor Prevention Act to prevent forced labor products in the US.
- Shein faced allegations of using cotton from Xinjiang province amidst reports of human rights abuses against Uyghurs.
- The company did not clarify if similar sourcing restrictions apply outside the US, such as in the UK, where it plans an IPO.

items.title: SenseTime spins off AI medical unit to drive growth
items.summary:
- SenseTime announced the spin-off of its AI medical unit to boost growth.
- The new unit aims to enhance its capabilities in artificial intelligence for healthcare applications.
- This strategic move is part of SenseTime's broader ambition to expand in the burgeoning AI market.

items.title: Indonesia’s banks are taking over BNPL. Can fintech firms survive?
items.summary:
- Banks in Indonesia are now dominant in the buy now, pay later (BNPL) sector, surpassing fintech firms and multifinance companies.
- Bank-issued paylater credit reached 21.8 trillion rupiah (US$1.3 billion) in November 2024, a 43% increase year-on-year.
- Six banks currently offering BNPL are BCA, Mandiri, BRI, SMBC Indonesia, Allo Bank, and DBS, compared to 62% growth in financing companies, which disbursed only 8.6 trillion rupiah (US$527 million).

items.title: China startup ‘godfather’ stresses need for innovation hubs
items.author: Li Zexiang
items.summary:
- Li Zexiang is establishing innovation hubs across China to support tech startups.
- He is known for nurturing successful tech startups, including DJI, and is referred to as China's startup 'godfather'.
- Advocates for multiple innovation hubs in China, similar to Silicon Valley, to meet the demands of a vast population.
- Promoting his incubation model at Songshan Lake XbotPark in Dongguan, aiding various startups.
- Recently led 30 startups to CES 2025 to showcase his model and facilities to the global tech community.

items.title: Veteran travel exec’s new startup sees new gold in airline cargo
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Jeff Pan, co-founder of Belli, identifies a significant opportunity in the underutilized cargo space of airlines, which fly with 85% of their cargo space empty.
- Belli provides software solutions for air cargo management, addressing issues like outdated processes and lack of real-time data visibility. 
- The startup has gained traction with three paying customers within six months, offering a more affordable solution than traditional cargo management software.

items.title: White House in talks for Oracle to take over TikTok: sources
items.summary:
- The White House is negotiating a deal for Oracle to gain majority control over TikTok.
- ByteDance, TikTok's parent company, would retain a minority stake.
- Oracle would manage TikTok's algorithm, data collection, and software updates.
- The deal aims to prevent ByteDance from accessing US user data, crucial for congressional approval.
- TikTok is currently not available for download, but Oracle has reinstated its services after a pause from a previous executive order.
- Ongoing negotiations are expected to lead to further developments.

items.title: Douyin expands services with in-app ride-hailing feature
items.summary:
- Douyin introduced a ride-hailing service in its app on Jan. 24.
- Users can access this feature in the "My Wallet" section; it directs to AMap Ride-Hailing.
- Supports various ride options like standard, shared, and airport transfers, with plans for more providers.

items.title: Southeast Asian startups that raised funds over 18 months ago
items.summary:
- Startups with at least 18 months of runway can focus on shipping without immediate fundraising concerns.
- A list was compiled of startups that last raised funds 18 months to three years ago, indicating various conditions.
- Possible scenarios for these startups include being profitable, reducing burn rates, securing unannounced funding, or facing fundraising challenges.
- The list does not imply positive or negative judgments about these businesses, just their last fundraising activity.

items.title: Glints’ glamor
items.author: Miguel Cordon
items.summary:
- Singapore-based Glints registered a 10% growth in revenue in 2024, mainly due to increased hiring from Chinese businesses.  
- Revenue from China doubled year on year.  
- Growth in quarterly job listings and active employers on the platform helped alleviate unemployment anxiety.  
- Glints expects continued growth from China into 2025.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Israel’s startups
items.summary:
- The article presents a list of the most active investors in Israel based on their investment in startups over the last two years.
- Investors are ranked by the number of deals, favoring those involved in early-stage investments.
- The focus is on firms that have invested in three or more Israeli startups during this period.

items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s SaaS startups?
items.summary:
- An updated list of active investors in Southeast Asia's Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) market over the past two years.
- Firms are categorized by the number of deals, favoring early-stage investors.
- Only firms that have invested in three or more companies in the region during this period are included.
- Data is ongoing, and inaccuracies can be reported via email for updates.

items.title: WeWork India reports 26.7% revenue growth for FY24
items.summary:
- WeWork India recorded a 26.7% revenue growth for FY24, totaling 1,665.14 crore rupees (US$193.15 million).  
- This is an increase from 1,314.52 crore rupees (US$152.48 million) in the previous fiscal year.  
- The net loss reduced by 7.5%, from 146.81 crore rupees (US$17.03 million) in FY23 to 135.77 crore rupees (US$15.75 million).  
- Total revenue, including other income, reached 1,737.16 crore rupees (US$201.50 million).  
- Credit rating agency ICRA upgraded the company's rating from BBB to A-, anticipating a 20-25% revenue growth due to increased desk capacities and steady occupancy rates.  
- WeWork India operates in 62 locations across major cities such as Bengaluru, Mumbai, Delhi, Gurugram, and Pune.  
- Established in 2016 as a joint venture between the Embassy Group and WeWork Global.

items.title: UAE fintech nets $4.1m pre-series A for Saudi expansion
items.summary:
- UAE fintech company secures $4.1 million in pre-Series A funding.
- The investment aims to support expansion into the Saudi Arabian market.
- This funding round highlights the increasing interest in fintech solutions in the region.

items.title: Alphabet stock hits $200 on AI optimism and growth
items.summary:
[Alphabet's stock closed above US$200 for the first time on January 24, ending at US$200.21.]
[This represents a 1.1% daily gain and a 6% rise year-to-date, outpacing Nasdaq's 3.3% growth.]
[The stock's performance is driven by optimism in AI advancements amidst competition and regulatory challenges, with a reported 15% revenue increase in Q3 2024, totaling US$88.3 billion in sales.]

items.title: Google expands AI education amid global regulation efforts
items.summary:
- Google is enhancing its Grow with Google initiative to include AI training programs.
- The company is collaborating with community colleges to add AI training to the Skilled Trades and Readiness program, focusing on data center jobs.
- Over 1 million individuals have received certificates from this initiative.
- As global AI regulations are developed, Google is engaging with policymakers regarding the implications of AI.
- Google is under increased regulatory scrutiny in the EU and US due to its substantial advertising and search market presence.
- Despite regulatory challenges, Google maintains a positive outlook on AI's ability to improve job functions without significantly displacing workers.

items.title: Trump’s first week: crypto orders, pardon, and bitcoin high
items.summary:
- US President Donald Trump enacted measures impacting the cryptocurrency sector in his first week.
- He signed an executive order to establish a working group with the Treasury, SEC, and CFTC to examine the use of government-seized cryptocurrencies.
- The SEC withdrew 2022 Staff Accounting Bulletin 121, lowering operational costs for financial institutions adopting cryptocurrencies.
- Trump granted a full pardon to Ross Ulbricht, founder of Silk Road, who was serving a life sentence for illegal bitcoin transactions.
- The launch of $TRUMP and $MELANIA memecoins raised concerns over conflicts of interest and both tokens have declined in value.
- Bitcoin reached a record price of US$109,000, highlighting investor optimism despite controversies.

items.title: Meta begins testing ads on Threads in US, Japan
items.author: Adam Mosseri
items.summary:
- Meta Platforms has launched advertisements on Threads in the US and Japan.
- A select group of brands will participate in this advertising initiative.
- Announcement made by Instagram head Adam Mosseri on January 24.
- This is Meta's first step toward monetizing Threads, which was launched in 2023.
- The effectiveness of this test will be assessed before expanding ads to other regions.
- The aim is to ensure ads are engaging and akin to organic content.
- As of December 2024, Threads had 300 million monthly users and over 100 million daily active users, as reported by CEO Mark Zuckerberg.

items.title: Vine coin soars to $200m amid talk of platform’s revival
items.author: Rus Yusupov
items.summary:
- Rus Yusupov, co-founder of Vine, launched a cryptocurrency called "Vine Coin."
- The announcement highlighted Vine's nostalgic impact and was made on X.
- The token's market cap quickly surpassed $200 million, trading at $0.16.
- Vine Coin joins the list of meme coins in the crypto space.
- Discussions about reviving Vine have been reignited, with support from Tesla CEO Elon Musk.
- Musk conducted a poll in April 2024 showing 70% support for a Vine reboot and has tasked engineers at X with assessing feasibility.

items.title: AI growth to drive 38% rise in US grid power demand
items.summary:
- PJM Interconnection LLC projects a 38% increase in peak summer electricity demand by 2035 due to AI technologies.
- This equates to a rise of nearly 58 gigawatts from 2024 levels.
- The surge is attributed to the rapid expansion of AI data centers requiring large amounts of electricity, straining the aging US power grid.

items.title: US’ DOGE says $420m in DEI contracts terminated
items.summary:
- The Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) has canceled around US$420 million in contracts in the first 80 hours of Donald Trump’s second term.
- This includes two lease agreements and contracts related to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) initiatives.
- No further details about the reasons for the cancellations have been provided.

items.title: Musk says X is ‘barely breaking even’ amid financial woes
items.summary:
- Elon Musk informed X employees that the company is “barely breaking even” due to stagnant user growth and disappointing revenue.
- Banks are preparing to sell parts of the US$13 billion debt from Musk’s 2022 Twitter acquisition.
- Major lenders like Bank of America, Barclays, and Morgan Stanley have delayed debt sales to avoid losses from economic changes and legal issues.
- Musk acknowledged X’s role in national discussions but noted ongoing financial struggles.
- X has not achieved cash-flow positivity and faces over US$1 billion in annual loan interest.

items.title: X rolls out vertical video feed globally, limited to iOS
items.summary:
- X, owned by Elon Musk, has started rolling out a vertical video feed globally, initially introduced in the US.
- The feature is now available in India, Australia, and parts of Europe, limited to iOS devices.
- It offers entertainment content and in-feed advertisements to enhance user engagement and revenue generation.
- Accessible via a dedicated tab next to the Grok button in the X app.
- This update aligns with X’s strategy to expand its video offerings, including a TV app and short-video features.

items.title: Indian AR startup SpotKwik acquired by US-based Omnia
items.summary:
- Bengaluru-based AR startup SpotKwik has been acquired by US-based Omnia in a full-stock transaction.
- Financial details of the deal were not disclosed.
- SpotKwik, founded in 2020, is recognized for enhancing shopping experiences with AR solutions and has received funding from the MARL 5G Accelerator.
- Omnia is valued at US$10 million and connects AR creators, enterprises, and brands with clients like Tesla, AOI, and GM.
- The acquisition will allow Omnia to integrate SpotKwik’s R&D capabilities and product solutions into its offerings.

items.title: Lightspeed leads $2b round for AI firm Anthropic
items.summary:
- Lightspeed Venture Partners has led a $2 billion funding round for AI company Anthropic, increasing its valuation to $60 billion.
- This valuation marks a significant rise from the previous year.
- Lightspeed manages $25 billion and has investments in Databricks and Elon Musk's xAI, valued at $62 billion and $50 billion respectively.
- Lightspeed has invested $2.2 billion in AI ventures prior to the Anthropic deal.
- The firm is also finalizing a $7 billion fundraising initiative for future AI projects.
- The AI sector faces risks such as high infrastructure costs and intense competition.

items.title: Wall Street banks to sell $3b in debt linked to X
items.summary:
- Wall Street banks are planning to sell $3 billion in debt tied to a company referred to as X.
- This transaction marks a significant financial move in the current market scenario.
- Details on the anticipated buyers and terms of the debt issuance are still emerging.

items.title: Blockchain firm Yudiz CFO resigns amid losses
items.summary:
- Yudiz, a blockchain firm, has announced the resignation of its CFO due to ongoing financial losses.
- The resignation raises concerns about the company's financial health and future direction.
- Yudiz had been facing significant challenges in recent months, affecting its operational stability.

items.title: Horizon Robotics unveils latest advances in smart driving
items.summary:
- Horizon Robotics updates its SuperDrive system with new features including an urban Navigate on Autopilot (NOA) mode for U-turns and reverse driving without human input.
- Introduced a 'roaming mode' for autonomous operation in enclosed areas without predefined routes.
- The system uses real-time environment rendering to enhance smart driving and decision-making, operating independently of high-precision maps.
- Mass production of SuperDrive technology vehicles is expected to start in Q3 2025, with deployments projected to exceed 10 million units.

items.title: Tesla, BYD to launch new SUVs to boost Japan’s EV market
items.summary:
- Tesla and BYD are set to introduce electric SUVs in Japan in April 2024.
- Tesla's Model Y will feature a range of up to 635 kilometers and includes eight cameras for driving assistance.
- BYD will launch the Sealion 7 SUV, offering a range of up to 590 kilometers with a touch panel for various functions.
- Japan's EV market faces challenges, with only about 60,000 EV units sold in 2024, a 33% decline from the previous year.
- EVs currently account for just 1.3% of total automobile sales in Japan.

items.title: Mitsubishi Motors opts out of Honda-Nissan merger
items.summary:
- Mitsubishi Motors will not participate in the Honda-Nissan merger proposal.
- The company will focus on collaboration in technology development, especially in software and EVs.
- Honda and Nissan announced a holding company plan in December for their operations.
- Mitsubishi, as Nissan’s top shareholder, made a decision by the end of January regarding the merger.
- This reflects Mitsubishi’s preference for partnerships over direct mergers amidst increasing competition from US and Chinese automakers.

items.title: ByteDance ends Lunar New Year red packets, revamps benefits
items.summary:
- ByteDance will stop distributing red packets during Lunar New Year starting in 2026, which provided employees with monetary gifts based on tenure.
- The company will make one last distribution of red packets in 2025, citing the need to distinguish 'incentives' from 'welfare'.
- New employee benefits include enhanced medical insurance, access to premium public hospital care, improved reimbursement rates, and dental benefits such as a 300 yuan allocation for teeth cleaning, along with free flu vaccinations for employees' children.
